channel.title: Port Forwarding on a NetGear WNR854T?
channel.description: Before you say go to moparscape, this is NOT for servers. Anyways, I am running a SSH server at home, behind my NetGear WNR854T router. I did "port forward" [with the router, but maybe I did something wrong?], but it still does not work, whenever I try connecting from any other computer I get no results. I can connect from localhost, however, so the server itself works. I have a RS private server running on another computer there, and it has no problems, so I know its possible. Sorry if this is seems somewhat disconnected from itself, but I am in class at the moment and need help fast. Thanks Justis PS Also, if I can't fix this, if anyone could do me the small favor of letting me run it on their server? :D It's not going to be used too much, so it won't eat your stuff up.

item.title: Port Forwarding on a NetGear WNR854T?
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

[quote=“ninja nub, post:4, topic:162932”]Well, I get the same problem, except I turned off literally every firewall and made port exceptions, and my port forward still wont work.

I heard if you have wireless it wont work, is that correct?[/quote] No I did it with wireless.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding on a NetGear WNR854T?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Before you say go to moparscape, this is NOT for servers.
Anyways, I am running a SSH server at home, behind my NetGear WNR854T router. I did “port forward” [with the router, but maybe I did something wrong?], but it still does not work, whenever I try connecting from any other computer I get no results. I can connect from localhost, however, so the server itself works. I have a RS private server running on another computer there, and it has no problems, so I know its possible. Sorry if this is seems somewhat disconnected from itself, but I am in class at the moment and need help fast.
Thanks
Justis
PS
Also, if I can’t fix this, if anyone could do me the small favor of letting me run it on their server? It’s not going to be used too much, so it won’t eat your stuff up.
